reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Finland's development policy is sustainable when Finnish citizens and the relevant interest groups rely on its effectiveness and essentially support its objectives.Development cooperation has traditionally enjoyed firm public support in Finland. During the past few years the weakening economic outlook combined with the need to cut public spending have challenged this support.The Foreign Ministry's development communications seek to make the development community's voice heard in the public debate on develop ment cooperation. As the governmental body responsible for development cooperation the Ministry for Foreign Affairs needs to be open and clear in its provision of information to the general public and network with the media and the interest groups in a tar get-oriented manner. Long-term global education is equally important as it paves the way for global citizenship.The Unit for Development Communications conducts a variety of communications projects and provides communication tools for the whole administrat ion.Publications are mainly produced in e-format. The most important printed publication in 2015 will be the development policy programme/work plan of the new government. The allowance for publications 100 000 euros will be used 2015-2016.
